segment.source: Windows spotlight on the lock screen (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows spotlight on the lock screen (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows spotlight is an option for the lock screen background that displays different background images on the lock screen.
segment.target: Windows spotlight is an option for the lock screen background that displays different background images on the lock screen.

segment.source: Windows spotlight on the lock screen
segment.target: Windows spotlight on the lock screen

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows spotlight is an option for the lock screen background that displays different background images and occasionally offers suggestions on the lock screen.
segment.target: Windows spotlight is an option for the lock screen background that displays different background images and occasionally offers suggestions on the lock screen.

segment.source: Windows spotlight is now available in Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Windows 10 Education.
segment.target: Windows spotlight is now available in Windows 10 Pro, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Windows 10 Education.

segment.source: For managed devices running Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, enterprise administrators can configure a mobile device management (MDM) or Group Policy setting to prevent users from using the Windows spotlight background.
segment.target: For managed devices running Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, enterprise administrators can configure a mobile device management (MDM) or Group Policy setting to prevent users from using the Windows spotlight background.

segment.source: What does Windows spotlight include?
segment.target: What does Windows spotlight include?

segment.source: Background image
segment.target: Background image

segment.source: The Windows spotlight displays a new image on the lock screen each day.
segment.target: The Windows spotlight displays a new image on the lock screen each day.

segment.source: The initial background image is included during installation.
segment.target: The initial background image is included during installation.

segment.source: Additional images are downloaded on ongoing basis.
segment.target: Additional images are downloaded on ongoing basis.

segment.source: lock screen image
segment.target: lock screen image

segment.source: Feature suggestions, fun facts, tips
segment.target: Feature suggestions, fun facts, tips

segment.source: The lock screen background will occasionally suggest Windows 10 features that the user hasn't tried yet, such as Snap assist.
segment.target: The lock screen background will occasionally suggest Windows 10 features that the user hasn't tried yet, such as Snap assist.

segment.source: How do you turn off Windows spotlight?
segment.target: How do you turn off Windows spotlight?

segment.source: Go to SettingsPersonalizationLock screenBackgroundWindows spotlight select a different lock screen background
segment.target: Go to SettingsPersonalizationLock screenBackgroundWindows spotlight select a different lock screen background

segment.source: personalization background
segment.target: personalization background

segment.source: How do you disable Windows spotlight for managed devices?
segment.target: How do you disable Windows spotlight for managed devices?

segment.source: Windows spotlight is enabled by default.
segment.target: Windows spotlight is enabled by default.

segment.source: Administrators can replace Windows spotlight with a selected image using the Group Policy setting Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesControl PanelPersonalizationForce a specific default lock screen image.
segment.target: Administrators can replace Windows spotlight with a selected image using the Group Policy setting Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesControl PanelPersonalizationForce a specific default lock screen image.

segment.source: lockscreen policy details
segment.target: lockscreen policy details

segment.source: Pay attention to the checkbox in Options.
segment.target: Pay attention to the checkbox in Options.

segment.source: In addition to providing the path to the lock screen image, administrators can choose to allow or Turn off fun facts, tips, tricks, and more on lock screen.
segment.target: In addition to providing the path to the lock screen image, administrators can choose to allow or Turn off fun facts, tips, tricks, and more on lock screen.

segment.source: If the checkbox is not selected, users will see the lock screen image that is defined in the policy setting, and will also see occasional messages, such as the example in the following image.
segment.target: If the checkbox is not selected, users will see the lock screen image that is defined in the policy setting, and will also see occasional messages, such as the example in the following image.

segment.target: fun facts
